TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataGridView/HitTestInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Contains information, such as the row and column indexes, about a specific coordinate pair in the control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.HitTest%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.HitTestInfo>. You can use this method to determine which part of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control is located at the specified coordinates. For example, you can call this method specifying the coordinates of a mouse click to determine the row and column indexes of the clicked cell or whether a header cell or scroll bar was clicked.
## Examples The following code example illustrates the use of this type. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.Columns%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property reference topic.

Docs.summary: Specifies that the point is not on a cell or cell header. This field is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.HitTest%2A> method returns <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.HitTestInfo.Nowhere> when the specified point is at an empty area of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.
